3.11.25  2:05 pm   why is sheet music so fucking hard to read, why does some of the notes sit on the lines and some of them are in the lines. what do the line sfucking mean why are they there why cant they just write what the note is like why cant they just say its like c4 instead of this weird blob that sits underneath in its own line why does it feel so fucking stupid to me what the fuck is a bass clef. am i just overcomplicating it or am i stupid or what bro

      it's no harder to read than.... english. but it just takes time for you to get accustomed to it. but you might not need to. in the age of the voice memo, there's a lot less of a necessity for it now than there used to be. so you only need to learn it if you really want to. kind of like...... horse riding

3.11.25  8:49 am   bill, i can't figure out rhythm and time. i've been told by civilians my note choices are good, but everything i play is whacky zany out of time in an unenjoyable way and i can't fuckin figure out why. how do i fix this? more metronome practice? counting out loud? maybe i'm just thinking too much. no idea. it's the final puzzle piece that needs to be solved, though. any tips will be greatly appreciated 

      first of all, what i say is going to sound terrible because i've never had this problem. my time has always been fine, and i was the kid who was always wondering why everyone else's time wasn't good. but here's the question that i think may be more useful: what kind of time do YOU like, and enjoy? if you can't hear it, you can't paint with it, so which colors do you see, and love? Or maybe you'd want to just start listening to clocks because they sound cool. but DO they sound cool? to you? just brainstorming here

3.11.25  7:21 am   you think I should focus on working really hard on one thing that I know people will like or is it better to just make and not spend to long on any one thing?

      that sounds like straight lines and curves. you're..... gonna wanna try both at some point

3.11.25  6:21 am   Is insanity funny if the insane person likes being insane and doesn't hurt anyone

      there are so many millions of ways for insanity to be funny, honestly i wouldn't have even thought of that one. i mean, insane and funny are almost synonyms. not quite, but slantonyms at least

3.11.25  3:56 am   What do you think your projects wholeheartedly make the viewer feel?

      if i'm doing my job correctly, then it should make at least someone feel the same way as i've felt. am i doing my job correctly? stay on the line for a brief survey

3.11.25  2:03 am   two years ago, a drummer friend of mine almost quit playing drums because he was forcing himself to practice in ways and play things that weren't fun for him. we talked, and i told him he needed to stop worrying about being the best and start having fun with his instrument. these past few months, ive been going through the exact same thing with the piano, and i only realized it when he told me the same thing i had told him years ago. but my mind seems to be wired in a way that makes it impossible for me to do that. any fun things u recommend doing?

lengthy question but telling some stranger in the internet if better than telling no one ig

     this may seem a little outside the box, but is there anything else you'd rather be doing?

3.11.25  1:30 am   Does thinking about the fact that people might listen to your music ever make it harder for you to work on your music?

      i was going to say no but now that i think about it yes. but i've had a lot of practice ignoring that

3.11.25  12:34 am   where you're from, do people pronounce the "i" in "anti-" (like in "antioxydant" or "anti-inflammatory" etc) as "ai" like in "Thai" or as "ee" like in "bee"? And if you heard the other prounciation would you understand it

      it's different depending on which word. you may have actually summed it up well if you look at your hyphen usage. the ones with hyphen would probably want to be more clear, 'anteye' and the ones that are more well-known words that don't need a hyphen, would probably be quicker 'antie'. and yes i would understand it both ways. heck i even know what 'anticlockwise' means, even though i grew up saying 'counter clockwise'

3.10.25  11:26 pm   How big is too big?

      don't worry about it. nothing is big

3.10.25  11:23 pm   do you find creative ideas to be better or more valuable when they come out of nowhere versus when you make yourself come up with them? i find myself doing both but the former tends to be wayy more creatively fulfilling/cathartic although it happens super rarely, while the latter is a way more reliable way of making things for me but i often find myself not caring nearly as much about it if i do it that way

      no need to discriminate. you can have both, you can do both, you can use both. there are advantages and disadvantages to each. the free gifted ones have the advantage of having a mythical quality to them and sometimes they are way deeper and more genuine sounding, but the disadvantage of course is that you have no control over when you get them, and also sometimes they're kind of bland or maybe even just something that already belongs to someone else. But for your idea-gen sessions, while it may seem like you could never get that same sparkle, the tip i have for getting the most out of the idea-gen is just do a lot. do A LOT. try to make the first 12 bad on purpose. Once you loosen up, you'll forget you're doing this and it will be essentially just like you're dreaming while you're awake, once the pressure is off. Also, ...... here's the other thing, when you do a lot of idea-gen all day, it will actually loosen you up so that when you take a break, or maybe in bed tonight or tomorrow, you'll find that you'll be suddenly receiving more of the rando gifts than you otherwise would. so it's a win-win. beyond that, just add them all to the same club and later down the line you'll find there's no need to discriminate between which ideas came from which methods. there's other methods too by the way

3.10.25  8:32 am   I played an original song for somebody and they had a negative reaction. Should I move to a new state and start a new life?

      basically you just need to not find out when your audience does or doesn't listen to your songs. you can still do things that encourage people to listen to them, but the trick is to keep yourself unaware of exactly who and when. eventually you will find out that there are people out there who need your music desperately
